items.name: Open approaches
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: Whether source or data or practice, the act of making something open reduces barriers to adoption, encourages collaboration and accelerates the evolution of the component.

items.name: Co-operation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Working with others. Sounds easy, actually it's not.

items.name: Exploiting network effects
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Techniques which increases the marginal value of something with increased number of users.

items.name: Industrial policy
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Government investment in a field.

items.name: Market enablement
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Encouraging the development of competition in a market

items.name: Exploiting constraint
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: Finding a constraint and reinforcing it through supply or demand manipulation. An existing constraint can be exploited to fragment a single player by increasing demand beyond their ability to supply (e.g. by creating a price war).

items.name: IPR
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: Intellectual property rights (IPR) can be used to slow evolution by limiting competition even to the point of ring fencing a component making it difficult for others to evolve it further.

items.name: Creating constraints
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Supply chain manipulation with a view of creating a new constraint where none existed.

items.name: Pig in a poke
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: A mechanism of dressing up a liability as some form of future business before divesting to a third party.

items.name: Sweat and Dump
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: A mechanism of disposing of legacy liability onto a third party by exploiting their own inertia to change.

items.name: Disposal of liability
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Overcoming the internal inertia to disposal. Your own organisation is likely to fight you even when you're trying to get rid of the toxic.

items.name: Sensing Engines (ILC)
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: A mechanism of being the first mover to industrialise a component, allowing others (the ecosystem) to build new industries upon it and then using consumption data to determine future candidates for industrialisation.

items.name: Two factor markets
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: A mechanism of bringing providers and consumers together and exploiting network effects and aggregated data.

items.name: Alliances
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating two competing bodies to become the focus of competition and in effect driving oxygen out of a market.

items.name: Channel conflicts & disintermediation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting new channels and conflict within existing channels to create favourable terms.

items.name: Co-creation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Working with end users to drive evolution of a specific activity, practice or data set.

items.name: Co-opting and intercession
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Copying competitors move and undermining any ecosystem advantage by interrupting data flows.

items.name: Embrace and extend
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Capturing an existing ecosystem.

items.name: Tower and moat
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Dominating a future position and prevent future competitors from creating any differential.

items.name: Fear, uncertainty and doubt
items.chapter_described: A smorgasbord of the slightly useful
items.description: Often used to slow evolution by exploiting inertia to change within customers and forcing new entrants to divert energy away from the components and into countering the accusations.

items.name: Artificial competition
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating two competing bodies to become the focus of competition and in effect driving oxygen out of a market.

items.name: Bundling
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Hiding a disadvantageous change by bundling the change with other needs.

items.name: Confusion of choice
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Preventing users from making rational decisions by overwhelming them with choice.

items.name: Creating artificial needs
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating and elevating an artificial need through marketing and behavioural influence. Take a rock and make it a pet etc.

items.name: Education
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Overcoming user inertia to a change through education. There are 16 different forms of inertia and many can be overcome directly with education. Don't underestimate this.

items.name: Lobbying / counterplay
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Persuading Government of a favourable position.

items.name: Centre of gravity
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating a focus of talent to encourage a market focus on your organisation.

items.name: Directed investment
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: VC approach to a specific or identified future change.

items.name: Experimentation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Use of specialists groups, hackdays and other mechanisms of experimentation.

items.name: Fool's mate
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Using a constraint to force industrialisation of a higher order system.

items.name: Playing both sides
items.chapter_described: TV Tropes
items.description: In any war, there are those that will benefit from the fighting and destruction that it causes.

items.name: Undermining barriers to entry
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Identifying a barrier to entry into a market and reducing it to encourage competition.

items.name: Fragmentation play
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting pricing effects, constraints and co-opting to fragment a competitor's market.

items.name: Misdirection
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Sending false signals to competitors or future competitors including investment focused on the wrong direction.

items.name: Reinforcing competitor inertia
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Identifying inertia within a competitor and forcing market changes that reinforce this.

items.name: Restriction of movement
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Limiting a competitors ability to adapt.

items.name: Sapping
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Opening up multiple fronts on a competitor to weaken their ability to react.

items.name: Talent raid
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Removing core talent from a competitor either directly or indirectly.

items.name: Defensive regulation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Using Government's to create protection for your market and slow down competitors.

items.name: Limitation of competition
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Through regulatory or other means including erecting barriers to prevent or limit competitors.

items.name: Managing inertia
items.chapter_described: I wasn't expecting that
items.description: Identify the forms of inertia you will face and how to counter them before charging straight on into the battle.

items.name: Procrastination
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Do nothing and allowing competition to drive a system to a more evolved form.

items.name: Raising barriers to entry
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Increasing expectations within a market for a range of user needs to be met in order to prevent others entering the market.

items.name: Threat acquisition
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Buying up those companies that may threaten your market.

items.name: Buyer / supplier power
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating a position of strength for yourself.

items.name: Differentiation
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Creating a visible difference through user needs.

items.name: Harvesting
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Allowing others to develop upon your offerings and harvesting those that are successful. Techniques for ensuring harvesting creates positive signals rather than creating an environment others avoid.

items.name: Last man standing
items.chapter_described: Amazon and the last man standing
items.description: In the last few years of the model when the price is dropping then it is all about last man standing. Many competitors won't be in a position to cope with how low the prices will go. The economies of scale will start to really tell here. Many will fall and it won't be gentle and graceful like. It'll be more brick like as in brick fired from a howitzer pointing downwards on the top of a building.

items.name: Pricing policy
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting supply and demand effects including price elasticity, Jevons paradox and constraints including fragmentation plays.

items.name: Signal distortion
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting commonly used signals in the market by manipulation of analysts to create a perception of change.

items.name: Standards game
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Driving a market to a standard to create a cost of transition for others or remove the ability of others to differentiate.

items.name: Designed to fail
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Removing potential future threats by poisoning a market space before anyone attempts to establish it.

items.name: Insertion
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Either through talent or misdirection, encouraging false moves in a competitor.

items.name: Licensing play
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Use of licensing to prevent future competitor moves.

items.name: Fast follower
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting fast follower advantage into uncharted spaces.

items.name: First mover
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Exploiting first mover advantage especially with industrialisation to component services.

items.name: Land grab
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Identifying and position a company to capture a future market space.

items.name: Weak signal / horizon
items.chapter_described: Bits or pieces?: On 61 different forms of gameplay
items.description: Use of common economic patterns to identify where and when to attack.
